episodeTitleJapanese: 大暴れ！無敵のフランキー将軍
description: Franky battles Baby 5 and Buffalo in his General Franky mech. Inside the collapsing laboratory, the Straw Hats and allies race to escape while Caesar Clown prepares a deadly strike. Doflamingo sends his farewells to Vergo and Monet, and the episode concludes with Monet pressing the island's self-destruct button.

events.title: Franky vs Baby 5 and Buffalo Begins
events.description: Franky, piloting the General Franky mech, engages in battle against the Donquixote Pirates members Baby 5 and Buffalo, who were sent by Doflamingo to retrieve Caesar Clown.
events.significance: Showcases the General Franky's combat capabilities and introduces a major obstacle for the Straw Hats' escape from Punk Hazard.

events.title: General Shield Debut
events.description: Franky detaches the upper portion of General Franky's shoulder with a star on it and uses it as a shield against Baby 5's attacks.
events.significance: First use of the General Shield technique, though it proves too small to be very effective for defense.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky using his defensive technique for the first time

events.title: General Shield Boomerang Debut
events.description: Franky throws the General Shield as a projectile weapon toward Baby 5 and Buffalo, though it is easily destroyed by them.
events.significance: Demonstrates an offensive application of the General Shield, though it proves ineffective against the Donquixote Pirates.

events.title: Baby 5's Weapon Transformations
events.description: Baby 5 demonstrates her Buki Buki no Mi abilities by transforming into various weapons including a sword (Espada Girl) and a missile (Missile Girl), which Buffalo launches at General Franky.
events.significance: Showcases the versatility and destructive potential of Baby 5's Devil Fruit powers in combination with Buffalo's abilities.

events.title: General Left Debut
events.description: Franky shoots bullets from General Franky's arm using four gun barrels underneath the circular panel on the hand.
events.significance: First use of General Left, adding to General Franky's ranged attack arsenal.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky unleashing bullets from General Franky's arm

events.title: Usopp Returns with Sea Stone Handcuffs
events.description: Usopp arrives in Room R with the Sea Stone handcuffs and Caesar Clown's former subordinates, preparing for the group's escape from the collapsing facility.
events.significance: The handcuffs will be crucial for restraining Caesar Clown and ensuring he cannot escape.

events.title: Momonosuke Sees His Father Petrified
events.description: Momonosuke is shocked and horrified to see his father Kin'emon's body petrified by Caesar's Shinokuni gas, carried in by Brook.
events.significance: An emotional moment highlighting the personal stakes for Momonosuke and setting up their eventual reunion.

events.title: Caesar Clown Regains Consciousness
events.description: After being defeated by Luffy, Caesar Clown regains consciousness and realizes he still possesses what he believes to be Smoker's heart.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic tension as Caesar prepares to take revenge by stabbing the heart.

events.title: Doflamingo's Farewell to Vergo
events.description: From Dressrosa, Doflamingo calls Vergo for a final message, thanking him for his service and apologizing for what is to come. He tells Vergo that he was his longest companion and thanks him for his hard work and devotion. Even in pieces, Vergo smiles.
events.significance: A poignant moment revealing Doflamingo's genuine affection for Vergo, one of his most loyal subordinates, and foreshadowing Vergo's impending death.

events.title: Doflamingo Orders Monet to Activate Self-Destruct
events.description: Monet calls Doflamingo for one last time and is asked by her captain to activate the island's self-destruct button. She apologizes for her failure and decides to set off the weapon to destroy the entire island.
events.significance: Demonstrates Monet's absolute loyalty to Doflamingo and sets up the catastrophic threat to everyone on Punk Hazard.

quotes.text: You will be the next Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet's final thoughts about Doflamingo as she prepares to sacrifice herself

events.title: General Cannon Debut
events.description: Franky brings the arms of General Franky together and fires a giant blast of compressed air toward Baby 5 and Buffalo, dealing heavy damage to them and the ice mountains of Punk Hazard over a large area. Franky describes this attack as an on-land version of the Thousand Sunny's Gaon Cannon.
events.significance: First use of General Franky's most powerful attack, showcasing its devastating firepower comparable to the Thousand Sunny's main weapon.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky unleashing the General Franky's ultimate attack

events.title: Monet Presses the Self-Destruct Button
events.description: With determination and obedience to Doflamingo, Monet bids her young master farewell and presses the island's self-destruct button, causing a massive explosion in the mountain base that threatens to destroy everyone on Punk Hazard.
events.significance: Creates a life-threatening situation for all characters on the island and demonstrates the extreme lengths Doflamingo's subordinates will go for him. The explosion marks a pivotal climax of the Punk Hazard Arc.

quotes.text: You will be the next Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet's final thoughts about Doflamingo before activating self-destruct

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky unleashing General Franky's ultimate attack

themes.description: The episode showcases extreme loyalty through Monet's willingness to sacrifice herself for Doflamingo's plans and Vergo's acceptance of his fate.
themes.symbolism: Monet's act of pressing the self-destruct button represents the ultimate sacrifice, showing the depth of her devotion to Doflamingo.

themes.description: Franky's General Franky mech demonstrates the combination of creativity and engineering, holding its own against Devil Fruit users.
themes.symbolism: The General Franky represents human innovation competing with supernatural Devil Fruit powers.
culturalReferences: References to giant robot/mecha anime genre

themes.description: Momonosuke's reaction to seeing his father petrified emphasizes the importance of family connections throughout the series.
themes.symbolism: Kin'emon's petrified form represents the consequences of parental sacrifice and protection.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his post-timeskip engineering prowess through General Franky, showcasing multiple new techniques and holding his own against two Devil Fruit users.
keyActions: Battles Baby 5 and Buffalo in General Franky
Debuts General Shield and General Shield Boomerang
Unleashes General Cannon for the first time

characterSpotlights.development: Monet's final moments showcase her unwavering loyalty to Doflamingo, willing to sacrifice herself and everyone on the island for his sake.
keyActions: Receives Doflamingo's order to activate self-destruct
quotes: You will be the next Pirate King.

characterSpotlights.development: Baby 5 demonstrates her Devil Fruit versatility by transforming into multiple weapon forms in combat.
keyActions: Collaborates with Buffalo in team attacks
Takes heavy damage from General Cannon

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo shows a rare moment of genuine emotion when bidding farewell to Vergo, while also demonstrating his ruthlessness by ordering the island's destruction.
keyActions: Accepts the sacrifice of his subordinates

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle scenes between Franky and Baby 5/Buffalo with additional choreography and techniques.
Additional dialogue and emotional moments were added to Doflamingo's farewells to Vergo and Monet.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to showcase all of General Franky's initial attack techniques in a single battle.
The General Cannon is described by Franky as an on-land version of the Thousand Sunny's Gaon Cannon, connecting his mech to his previous engineering achievement.
Episode 619 adapts manga chapters 693-694, which were released in 2013, the same year as the episode's broadcast.
The opening song 'We Go!' returned for episodes 619-628 after 'Hands Up!' was used for episodes 591-618.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Monet's death scene is one of the most debated moments in One Piece, with many fans theorizing she may have survived based on ambiguous visual cues.

sources.title: Monet isn't dead (Theory) - One Piece Wiki
